bookCover.coverDescription: In this book we will learn about living thing and their features.

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text: The world is made up of various things. Some of the items are living, while others are not. Living things are objects that can eat, breathe, reproduce, move on their own, respond to their surroundings and adapt to them. For example, butterflies, trees, dogs, cats, rats, human beings, and so on. Non-living things are those that cannot eat, breathe, reproduce, or move on their own and do not need to adapt and respond to their surroundings. For example: a chair, books,a table, a ball, a bat, a rock, and so on.

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text: Different types of living things can be seen below:
Animals include mammals (i.e. dogs, cats, monkeys, etc.), reptiles (i.e. snakes, turtles, etc.), aquatic creatures (sharks, goldfish, etc.), and birds (i.e. parrots, pigeons, sparrows, etc.).
Insects are small living things whose bodies are divided into three parts and have three or more pairs of legs and wings. It includes living things like bees, ants, butterflies, beetles, flies, etc.
Plants include living things like trees, herbs, shrubs, and flowering and non-flowering plants.

We cannot observe growth and development of all living things.

Living things rarely adjust to their surrounding as they cannot sense anything.
